intro: Parachampionella tashiroi, commonly known as the Tashiro's parachute plant, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Okinawa in Japan. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are surrounded by pale green bracts, giving it a unique appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
